metadata.title: CVE-2016-2828 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in Mozilla Firefox before 47.0 and Firefox ESR45.x before 45.2 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code viaWebGL content that triggers texture access after destruction of thetexture's recycle pool.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2828` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
